name: 黃秀英
objective:
Course Title: Dynamics (動力學)
Pre-requisite: 3001011 or approved by the course instructor. 
Course Contents: Force, mass, and acceleration, particle kinematics, particle dynamics, work and energy, impulse and momentum, rigid body motion, and dynamics of the rigid body system.
General applications, vehicle dynamics, and railway vehicles will be introduced, such as basic dynamics, vehicle dynamics, wheel-rail coupled, railway vehicle climbing and slipping, aerodynamics, vehicle dynamics and resistance of railway vehicles, railway vehicle braking, and applications of railway vehicles.
This course can be counted for credits if pursuing a micro-program in railway vehicles.
schedule:
Course Title: Dynamics (動力學)
Week    Topics
1)     Syllabus & Introduction to Dynamics
2)     Kinematics of Particles: Rectilinear & Curvilinear Motions
3)     Kinetics of Particles: Newton’s Second Law (Examples: basic dynamics, vehicle dynamics)
4)     Kinetics of Particles: Newton’s Second Law (Examples: wheel-rail coupled, railway vehicle climbing and slipping) 
5)     Kinetics of Particles: Energy and Momentum Methods
6)     Kinetics of Particles: Energy and Momentum Methods
7)     Kinetics of Particles: Energy and Momentum Methods &
Systems of Particles
8)     Systems of Particles
9)     Midterm Exam
10)    Kinematics of Rigid Bodies (Examples: aerodynamics, vehicle dynamics, and resistance)
11)    Kinematics of Rigid Bodies
12)    Kinematics of Rigid Bodies & Plane Motion of Rigid Bodies
13)    Plane Motion of Rigid Bodies: Forces and Accelerations (Examples: railway braking, and some applications of railway vehicles)
14)    Plane Motion of Rigid Bodies: Energy and Momentum Methods
15)    Plane Motion of Rigid Bodies: Energy and Momentum Methods
16)    Kinetics of Rigid Bodies in Three Dimensions
17)    Mechanical Vibrations
18)    Final Exam
